page.title: 03The Scout Movement
page.content: {THE SCOUT MOVEMENT { Baden Powell was a famous Army Scout, his most exciting adventures happened in Africa when he matched his wits against ferocious natives. They called him "Impeesa"-'The wolf who does not sleep'. His job was the training of army scouts. He found that the men enjoyed it and became better men for it. So he thought that boys should have the fun of being a scout. So he started the scouting movement. The first camp was at Brownsea Island in 1907. Now, in 1985, scouting is still popular, but on a greater scale. Troups of scouts often go camping in the holidays. They meet once a week, have sports, games and competitions and enjoy themselves. They take part in church parades and learn to serve the community.
